info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 2 at 9:07AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma...
Beaver Creek at Waurika affecting Jefferson County.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Beaver Creek at Waurika.
* WHEN...From this morning until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands along the creek in Jefferson County in south central Oklahoma extends from near Waurika to near Sugden... southward to the confluence of Beaver Creek with the Red River.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 20.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 23.1 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
